project

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • project.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Computer, User

    public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates a player in a game of crazy eights.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Hand hand
      The hand: the cards held by one player.
      protected java.lang.String name
      The name of the player

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String name)
      Instantiates a new player with an empty hand.

    • Method Summary

      void display()
      Display the cards in player's hand.

      Display the player's name and score.

      Gets the hand.

      Gets the name.
      abstract Card play(Game crazyEight, Card prev)

      int score()

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name.
        Returns:
        the name of the player.

      • getHand

        public Hand getHand()
        Gets the hand.
        Returns:
        the player's hand.

      • play

        public abstract Card play(Game crazyEight,
                          Card prev)
        Play: this is an abstract method and must be implemented in any derived class.
        Parameters:
        crazyEight, - gives access to the "draw pile".
        prev, - the previously played card.
        Returns:
        a card from the player's hand.

      • score

        public int score()
        Score: calculates the player's score (penalty points).

        Note: as soon as a player has no cards, the game ends and all other players score penalty points for their remaining cards. Eights are worth 20, face cards are worth 10, and all others are worth their rank.

        Returns:
        the score

      • display

        public void display()
        Display the cards in player's hand.

      • displayScore

        public void displayScore()
        Display the player's name and score.

      • cardMatches

        public static boolean cardMatches(Card card1,
                                  Card card2)
        Card matches: two cards match if their rank or suit is the same.

        Note: if card1's rank is 8, it is a Wild Card. A wild card can match any other card

        Parameters:
        card1, - the card 1
        card2, - the card 2
        Returns:
        true, if card1 matches card2
